lines.text: Tell me something, Chris. Where do you stand? Are you riding with the brand... or are you running scared?
Well, what are you up to, Conagher? Drifting again?
I got tumbleweed fever.
You, too? Half of the cowboys in the country are chasing tumbleweed.
Who gave you the black eye?
No one gave it to me, son. I fought for it.

You keep a close lookout for Indians, ma'am. They ain't been troublesome lately, but you never can tell when they might start up again. Never give 'em anything. They take that as a sign of fear. Make 'em trade. They cotton to that.
Why didn't you draw on Kiowa?
You mean, was I afraid? Staples didn't need killing. He needed to be taught a lesson.
He'd had killed you if he had the chance.

He might have. But I'll tell you something, kid. Any man who kills when he could do otherwise is crazy. Just plumb crazy. Some men take to a side of killing, Johnny. Just make sure when the killing time comes, you're standing on the right side.
Hell, you're so weak you can hardly stand.
If you want to see how weak I am, try for your gun.
No, you've got just enough sand left in ya to kill me.
I don't know you, cowboy, and you don't know me, but if you got any ideas about bucking trouble, I'm afraid you're going to have to go it alone.
You want to help me?

Well, I'm up into my 70s, boy. And I got a bum ticker to boot. I was kind of hoping to just live out my days and not die out on some sandy slope with lead in my guts. If they get me out on that range, they'll kill me for sure and then just take my cattle as they please... with nobody to stop 'em.
What if they come after you?
If they come after me, I damn sure will fight.
You better keep a rifle handy.
Kill him? Kid, you don't know what you're talking about. I may be an outlaw, but I've never murdered anybody in cold blood... and least of all an hombre.
You're a hard man, Conagher.
It's a hard country, kid.
Hey, Conagher! I'll buy the drinks.
You buy... I'll drink.
Damn you, Conn, you're pushing me!
It seems to me I'm the one being pushed.
You're a damn fool. They're going to clean the old man out by spring. Now you can do your job and look the other way, or you can set yourself up as a target. You got a choice.
No, you got a choice. You can throw your pack on your horse and ride out of here tonight, or you can go for your gun.
You don't know what music is until you hear the wind in the cedars.
Takes nerve to bring up a boy when a woman's alone.
...any man who asks for help better not start out in the first place.
